review: The Chromecast allows me to view any web content on my 47" TV with no wires,I can control it from my laptop,tablet and smartphone.The price and wireless makes it a no brainer.There are many products to stream web content to TV,but they are bulky,not as dependable and priced well over $100.00.I even cancelled cable because I can send any show to my TV with this and control it via multiple devices FREE.I highly recommend this product.
author: Sweeperguy

review: I bought this to stream HBO GO from my tablet to my television. It does that very well. I was afraid the TV was too far from the router to get a good signal. The Chromecast works flawlessly -- never rebuffers or stutters. The viewing experience is quite good quality. You do have to plug in the power or USB to power the device. That makes it slightly less portable than it looks, however I switch it between televisions quite regularly with little effort. It's limited in what is supported at the moment. I'm banking that will change as it catches on. Currently you cannot cast a Google Chrome browser tab from an Android tablet. That seems strange to me, but it is the case. Casting from your PC performance depends on how fast your PC is.

author: Todd Burns

review: We have enjoyed using our Chromecast. It's worth the money. The problem that we have is that it doesn't play well with Amazon streaming video. It will only stream in a minimized screen with sound. Maximize the screen and the sound goes away.It doesn't work at all with any videos we have through iTunes. I understand that is more likely because of Apple than Google. After all, they don't want the Apple TV replaced, right?We do like the ability to stream directly from our web browser for most other sites, in that it performs it's function well, which is the entire reason I purchased this as a gift for my husband.
